abstract.p: List of outlets for smoked Irish salmon in New York City (S)

block.p: NOT nearly as common as Norwegian, Scottish or other varieties, Irish smoked salmon can be found in many New York restaurants and food shops.

The wild smoked salmon of Ireland is generally considered superior to the farmed kind. It can be found on the menus of some restaurants featuring Irish foods, like Half King (505 West 23rd Street, 212-462-4300), a new restaurant and bar in Chelsea. It is served on top of warm goat cheese potato cakes, and in a salad with horseradish, cucumbers and capers. Neary's (358 East 57th Street at First Avenue, 212-751-1434), an Irish pub, serves its smoked salmon with capers and onions. At Tir Na Nog (5 Penn Plaza, on Eighth Avenue at 34th Street, 212-630-0249) you'll find a lunchtime sandwich made with the salmon on brown bread with prosciutto and dill sauce. At dinner, it's layered with blini and dilled creme fraiche.
NOT nearly as common as Norwegian, Scottish or other varieties, Irish smoked salmon can be found in many New York restaurants and food shops.

The wild smoked salmon of Ireland is generally considered superior to the farmed kind. It can be found on the menus of some restaurants featuring Irish foods, like Half King (505 West 23rd Street, 212-462-4300), a new restaurant and bar in Chelsea. It is served on top of warm goat cheese potato cakes, and in a salad with horseradish, cucumbers and capers. Neary's (358 East 57th Street at First Avenue, 212-751-1434), an Irish pub, serves its smoked salmon with capers and onions. At Tir Na Nog (5 Penn Plaza, on Eighth Avenue at 34th Street, 212-630-0249) you'll find a lunchtime sandwich made with the salmon on brown bread with prosciutto and dill sauce. At dinner, it's layered with blini and dilled creme fraiche.

A few specialty shops carry smoked wild Irish salmon. One is Sables (1489 Second Avenue, at 78th Street, 212-249-6177), which sells it for $28 a pound. Jefferson Market (450 Sixth Avenue, at 11th Street, 212-533-3377) has quarter-pound packages for $7.99; at the deli it's $23.96 a pound. Zabar's, Fairway, Leonard's and Grace's Marketplace sell the farmed kind. Zabar's (2245 Broadway, at 80th Street, 212-787-2000), sells it for $24 a pound, but the supply is limited. Salmon at Fairway (2127 Broadway, at 74th Street, 212-595-1888) is $24 a pound. Leonard's (1385 Third Avenue, at 79th Street, 212-744-2600) has oak-smoked salmon at $6.95 for four ounces. Grace's Marketplace (1237 Third Avenue, at 71st Street, 212-737-0600) charges $33.96 a pound.
